metadata.name: Tale of the Pig King
metadata.description:
TALE OF THE PIG KING collaboration by Joe Whale & Henrik Uldalen & Tania Rivilis & Victoria West & Laurence Fuller

Fables weave the fabric of our culture, they are the underlying narratives that make up the human story. From our earliest years, we read fables to our children as the creativity of the young connects poetic metaphors to the world around us. Through fables of caution, folly, consequence and triumph, we learn of our frailties and fervor, negotiating with giants and outwitting witches with dangerous intentions to claim the prize with grace and save the day from conflicting forces. Fables are the timeless universal human stories we follow as guiding lights like a map of our emotional and spiritual lives.” —Laurence Fuller, Actor, Poet & Web3 Artist

Be grateful for what you have ~ unless you wish to chase bliss forever.

Doodle by Joe Whale (AKA The Doodle Boy)
Digital Painting by Henrik Uldalen
Digital Painting by Tania Rivilis
Photography by Victoria West
AI Animation & Music by Laurence Fuller
Poetry by Laurence Fuller
Produced & Performed by Laurence Fuller

Once Upon A Time,
There was a sleeping King.
He followed the lines,
In front of his eyes,
As they curled into the forest,
Where they live.

Sunk into Leda’s lake,
Surrounded by sirens of an unusual fate,
They flutter shifting shapes,
These sirens pull him deeper,
Their feathers make him weaker,
The forest reflecting glimmers on the water,
PULL HIM UNDER

Wolves run through the fog,
Bloated croaking frogs,
Wet, cold and steaming rocks,
Their paws trampling leaves & roots & logs,
Sprinting over moss,
They howl as their paths cross

He thought he married well,
Sealed it with a black lipped kiss,
Now it’s a hopeless tale to tell,
Lost forever chasing bliss.
Under the spell of the white witch.

Emerging from the lake,
Hooves, and snout in wait,
Such an unusual fate,
The form that was once a King,
Transformed into a pig.

~ Laurence Fuller, 2023
